intro: Hieracium lagopus, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and serrated, while its flowers are yellow and daisy-like, often appearing in clusters. Hieracium lagopus is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in nutrient-poor soils.
